intro: Micranthes oblongifolia, commonly known as the narrow-leafed mouse-ear. It is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the western United States, characterized by its small, oblong leaves and clusters of tiny, white to pale pink flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, rocky habitats such as stream banks and meadows. Its foliage is often covered in fine hairs, giving it a soft, fuzzy appearance. Micranthes oblongifolia is part of the Boraginaceae family, which is known for its showy, often blue or violet flowers.
